title: Use distributive property
text: Use distributive property to rewrite the expression $$\frac{63m^4-42m^3}{\left(-7m^2\right)}=\frac{63m^4}{\left(-7m^2\right)}-\frac{42m^3}{\left(-7m^2\right)}$$
speech: Use distributive property to rewrite the expression  fraction, 63 m to the fourth, minus 42 m cubed, over, parentheses, negative 7 m squared, ,  is equal to fraction, 63 m to the fourth, over, parentheses, negative 7 m squared, ,  minus fraction, 42 m cubed, over, parentheses, negative 7 m squared, ,

title: Use distributive property
text: As a reminder, the distributive law states $$\left(a-b\right) c=a c-b c$$
speech: As a reminder, the distributive law states  parentheses a minus b,  times c is equal to, a c minus b c
pacedSpeech: As a reminder, the distributive law states    a minus b,  times c is equal to, a c minus b c

title: Use distributive property
text: in this case, we can see divided by $$\left(-7m^2\right)$$ as multiply by $$\frac{1}{\left(-7m^2\right)}$$, $$a=63m^4$$ , $$b=42m^3$$, $$c=\frac{1}{\left(-7m^2\right)}$$
speech: in this case, we can see divided by  parentheses, negative 7 m squared,   as multiply by  fraction, 1 over, parentheses, negative 7 m squared, ,  ,  a is equal to, 63 m to the fourth,  ,  b is equal to, 42 m cubed, ,  c is equal to fraction, 1 over, parentheses, negative 7 m squared, ,

title: Simplify each term in expression
text: As a reminder, the power rule states for any integer $$m$$, $$n$$ and real number a, $$\frac{a^m}{a^n}=a^{m-n}$$
speech: As a reminder, the power rule states for any integer  m ,  n  and real number a,  fraction, a to the m-th, over, a to the n-th,  is equal to, a raised to the m minus n power
pacedSpeech: As a reminder, the power rule states for any integer   m
and real number a,   fraction, a to the m-th, over, a to the n-th,  is equal to, a raised to the m minus n power

title: Combine the simplified terms
text: As our last step, we can put the simplified terms back to the $$\operatorname{expression}\left(\frac{63m^4}{\left(-7m^2\right)}\right)-\frac{42m^3}{\left(-7m^2\right)}$$

subHints.title: Combine the simplified terms
subHints.text: in the expression $$\frac{63m^4}{\left(-7m^2\right)}-\frac{42m^3}{\left(-7m^2\right)}$$, replace $$\frac{63m^4}{\left(-7m^2\right)}$$ with $$-9m^2$$, and replace $$\frac{42m^3}{\left(-7m^2\right)}$$ with $$-6m$$ then we yield a new expression
